course_name: Professional Certificate Program in Cloud Computing and DevOps
description: The learner journey includes foundational courses in Python and Cloud Computing, followed by in-depth modules on AWS, Azure, and Google Cloud Platform, covering databases, networking, security, and DevOps practices like Docker, CI/CD, Kubernetes, and IaC.
eligibility: Bachelor's degree with 50%. Prior coding knowledge will be highly beneficial.

projects.title: Kubernetes-Based Microservices Platform on AWS EKS
projects.description: Develop a proof-of-concept for a scalable, resilient microservices architecture using Kubernetes on AWS EKS, deploying stateless and stateful workloads.

projects.title: Scalable Continuous Deployment for High-Traffic E-commerce on Azure
projects.description: Ensure seamless scalability and zero downtime for an e-commerce platform during a high-traffic season using a robust continuous delivery and deployment strategy on Azure.

projects.title: Enhancing the Scalability of BookMyShow
projects.description: Analyze and resolve performance bottlenecks in a ticketing platform to enhance scalability and reliability for high-traffic events.

projects.title: Multi-Cloud Disaster Recovery for Financial Services
projects.description: Implement a disaster recovery and business continuity solution across AWS and Microsoft Azure to build a resilient, geo-redundant infrastructure.

modules.description: A refresher on Python fundamentals relevant for Cloud and DevOps.
Overview of cloud concepts, service types (IaaS, PaaS, SaaS), cloud types (Public, Private, Hybrid), and multi-cloud strategies.
Overview of AWS, setting up an account, and introduction to core services like EC2, S3, RDS, VPC, and IAM.
Learn about VPC for networking, IAM for security, Security Groups, Network ACLs, Auto Scaling, and Load balancing.
Understanding DevOps principles, Version Control with Git, and an introduction to Docker for containerization, including its architecture and components.
Learn Continuous Integration concepts and set up CI/CD pipelines using Jenkins, integrating with Git and using AWS CodeBuild.
Introduction to IaC with Terraform, learning syntax, configuration files, state management, and best practices for provisioning infrastructure.
Introduction to Ansible for configuration management, covering playbooks, YAML syntax, roles, tasks, and Ansible Tower.
Introduction to Kubernetes, its architecture, deploying applications on clusters, and managing resources with kubectl.
Learn advanced Kubernetes concepts like Deployments, StatefulSets, scaling, security best practices, and cluster administration.
Overview of Microsoft Azure, setting up an account, and learning about services like Virtual Machines, Blob Storage, Azure SQL Database, Azure Functions, and Azure Active Directory.
Implementing CI/CD pipelines with Azure DevOps, container orchestration with AKS, and deploying infrastructure with ARM templates.
Overview of GCP, setting up an account, and learning services like Compute Engine, Cloud Storage, Cloud SQL, VPC, and IAM.

modules.module_title: CI/CD and IaC on Google Cloud Platform
modules.description: Setting up CI/CD pipelines with Google Cloud Build, container orchestration with GKE, and infrastructure provisioning using Deployment Manager and Puppet.
Learn DevSecOps principles, integrating security into the DevOps pipeline, security automation, code analysis, container security, and secrets management.
Implement the DevOps pipeline for an advanced use case and get an introduction to SynOps methodology for optimizing operational processes.

modules.module_title: AI Tools for Cloud and DevOps
modules.description: Understand how GenAI is impacting Cloud services and DevOps using tools like Harness, APMs, CodeGuru, and Snyk.
